page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO DIDCOT
page.content: Didcot is a small town in the South of England. It is situated in Oxfordshire. There are few shops in Didcot, but they are sufficient for the people's needs. Half-day closing is Wednesday. Didcot has a reasonable number of activities, including three thriving Drama societies, keepfit, ballet, clubs, badminton and dancing. Most of these activities are held in the Civic Centre. There is also a Youth Centre in which Junior and Senior residents can hold clubs, discos etc. Most inhabitants do not have any complaints about their town, but some feel it could do with more shops and others would like to see more facilities for teenagers. Didcot grew in importance partly because of the Great Western Railway. It is an expanding town with increasing light industry.
